The transfer window: acting on impulse

Sean Cole explores the on-goings of the latest transfer window (Thumbnail credit One of these men is apparently worth PS35m. Can you guess which one? Image: Steenbergs via Flickr Creative Commons)

Women's badminton back to winning ways against city rivals

The women's badminton team completed a league double over neighbours York St. John University on Wednesday, winning 5-3. (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Women's rugby overcome York. St John in tight encounter

The women's rugby firsts went up against local rivals York. St John last week and came out on top, winning 10-0 (Thumbnail credit The women's rugby team, pictured here last season, are enjoying a very successful season. Image: George Lowther)

Men's squash firsts fail to reproduce cup win

Following up their 3-2 cup win over Northumbria two weeks ago was always going to be a hard task for the York team and so it proved as they went down 4-1 to the league-leaders. (Thumbnail credit The men's squash side, successful against Northumbria in the cup two weeks ago (pictured here), were less fortunate in the league yesterday. Image: Peter Iveson)

Comfortable win for men's rugby over Northumbria seconds

Five tries from the men's rugby firsts allowed them to coast past Northumbria University seconds 31-0 (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Basketball seconds suffer heavy loss to St. John

York seconds fell to a heavy defeat at the hands of bitter rivals York St. John yesterday as the visitors ran out winners by 80 points to 57 (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Smash-and-grab victory for Durham thirds in women's hockey

A late goal from Allie Watts sealed a unlikely win for Durham thirds as they managed to leave York with all three points despite being under the cosh from the first minute to the last (Thumbnail credit The jubilation on the Durham team's faces as they left the field was clear to see. Image: Peter Iveson)

New proposals mean York Sport membership could be free by 2012

The University and York Sport have combined to form a plan which could potentially see York Sport membership becoming free (Thumbnail credit Sam Asfahani says he is "very confident" that the plans will come to fruition. Image: Peter Iveson)

York Centurions take hard-fought inaugural win in spirited fightback against Varsity opposition

A final-quarter fightback from York Centurions saw the University's American Football team do enough to overcome their University of Hull counterparts on 22 Acres on Sunday afternoon (Thumbnail credit Sunday's victory was the first for the centurions in 12 attempts, ending a win drought that spanned two years. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

York Sport and RAG take on 12 sports in 12 hours

It was billed as the ultimate endurance event and for the competitors from the York Sport and RAG teams the challenge was simple: playing 12 sports in 12 consecutive hours (Thumbnail credit Dodge, duck, dip, dive and dodge: James Croydon takes aim. Image: Peter Iveson)

Futsal firsts toil as Sheffield Hallam and Leeds Metropolitan Carnegie exploit small squad

York have a mountain to climb if they are to reach the nationals of the BUCS Futsal championships after a frustrating Sunday in Sheffield (Thumbnail credit Captain Ash Daly, pictured here in action for the futsal team last year. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Pool and Snooker club chalk up success after success

Amidst the industrial landscape of James Street, in the close confines of a dark and intimately lit room of the Cueball Snooker Club, resides the University of York Pool and Snooker Club (Thumbnail credit Pool at York is "on the up" as with more interest than ever before. Image: Peter Iveson)

The Mixer

By James Bithell

You have to feel for Andy Burton. Somewhere on the 1st of February the suspended Sky Sports News presenter was sitting, sobbing gently, surrounded by total, desolate silence (Thumbnail credit Short of games at Spurs, Robbie Keane ponders whether to sign a contract for thirteen year old Lucy Taylor. 'Arry provided him with the pen. Image: Oliver N5)

Cutting York Sport membership is welcome but overdue

If every cloud has a silver lining then news coming from York Sport this week is a shiny sliver around the huge, black weather system that is the tuition fees increase (Thumbnail credit Radical changes could be coming to the Sports Centre under new plans. Image: Peter Iveson)

Men's lacrosse draw in frenetic encounter with Yorkshire rivals

The men's lacrosse team battled to a draw that looked improbable at some points during their BUCS clash with local rivals Leeds this Wednesday (Thumbnail credit The White Rose look to win back possesion on the 22 acres Image: Peter Iveson)

Women's footballers halt high-flying Newcastle to claim first win

York's women's footballers claimed their first victory of the season with a hard-fought win over Newcastle University firsts (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Depleted football seconds comfortably defeated by Leeds

York's seconds football team fell to a 3-0 defeat against high-flying Leeds thirds on Wednesday, in a match marred by controversy (Thumbnail credit Sam Clitheroe fends off a Leeds cross. Image: Peter Iveson)

Scottish football needs to look South

Christopher Underwood argues that, in order to progress, Scottish football needs to look South (Thumbnail credit Kris Boyd left Rangers to join Middlesbrough in the summer. Image: superleague formula: thebeautifulrace via Flickr Creative Commons)

Late comeback not enough for men's hockey team

York succumbed to a series of offensive onslaughts against local and league rivals Leeds this Wednesday afternoon (Thumbnail credit Image: Phillipa Grafton)

Badminton firsts end season with thrilling win

The men's badminton firsts had to win on Sunday afternoon to secure their place in the Northern Conference 1A league and win they did, defeating the University of Liverpool 5-3 thanks mainly to captain James Davies (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

2011 - The Year of Andy Murray?

Luke Gardener previews the year ahead for Andy Murray, following his Australian Open final defeat (Thumbnail credit Andy Murray in action at Wimbledon in 2009. Image: E01 via Flickr Creative Commons)

David Ambrozejczyk delivers your weekly fix of all things American sport (Thumbnail credit Carmelo Anthony. Image: Keith Allison via Flickr Creative Commons)

DeGale could lead the way in 2011

Boxing expert Graham Lilley returns, this time assessing 2011 for British boxing, in particular focusing on James Degale (Thumbnail credit James DeGale, pictured here with fellow Brit Tony Jeffries. Image: photoverulam via Flickr Creative Commons)

Seventh heaven for Derwent as Vanbrugh brushed aside

A hat-trick from Dan Atherton helped Derwent on their way to a 7-3 hammering of Vanbrugh on Sunday morning (Thumbnail credit Derwent's Dan Atherton shoots for goal against Halifax last week)

Goodricke razor-Sharpe as striker bags five

Goodricke's Jon Sharpe, perhaps the stand-out performer of last term's College Football, carried on his good form with all five of his side's goals as they trounced Alcuin (Thumbnail credit Jon Sharpe shoots for goal last term against Vanbrugh. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Rawlings brace fails to prevent workmanlike Halifax

Halifax narrowly overcame perennial underdogs Wentworth 3-2, thanks to goals from skipper Tom Ragan, Mark Lund and Conor Brennan (Thumbnail credit Halifax's Dom Petschak, seen here in action against Derwent last week. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Langwith earn first point with 1-1 draw

A goal from Andy Hutt meant Langwith earned their first points of the term in a 1-1 draw with James (Thumbnail credit Langwith's Cameron Craig, pictured here in action against Goodricke last week. Image: Aaste Haukvik Traen)

Nouse Sport Podcast

By James Bithell

A busy and successful day of BUCS Wednesday is discussed and analysed by the Nouse Sport team, who then go on to debate the merits of replacing York St. John with the University of Hull, air their views on Keys/Gray/Masseygate and have a look at the ins and outs of the January transfer window. Do me a favour love, and listen! (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)
